While not my favorite game ever, I legitimately cannot think of a single flaw in Portal 2.
p o t a t o s

Overall: 9/10 [Outstanding]

This game is a massive improvement over the first Portal game, it is much longer, has a much cooler post-apocalyptic theme, and the new characters are really funny and interesting such as Wheatley, Cave Johnson, and "Caroline", the game covers mostly all the questions left behind in the first Portal game, there are many new interesting and beautiful environments, new mechanics such as the bounce, speed, and portal gels, as well as excursion funnels and more, the game feels a lot more well put together with a much more intriguing story, the puzzles are a lot harder for me in this one towards the end, and I love the ending, this game overall is inspiring to me because I love physics and testing scientific hypotheses to find the truth.
It's a great game overall, especially for people that like puzzle games

[u] Please describe what you liked or disliked about this product.[/u]

Answer:
[i]Portal[/i]

Don't know what else I should add in the reviews that hasn't been said.

At times, challenging and frustrating but it's a game you can play at your pace so you don't feel rushed.

The dialogue is great even though your character doesn't talk.

The map and puzzle design is great. Doesn't loose it's charm throughout the game.

Haven't played the co-op unfortunately but someday would love to.

A fantastic sequel of the first Portal game which is also great
Zeki bir arkadaşım olsaydı çok keyifli olurdu diye düşünüyorum

Für den Preis von 8.19 Euro ist es wirklich preiswert und wirklich zu empfehlen.
Es bietet eine sehr schöne Story und gute Spielelemente. Die Rätsel sind sehr gut gestaltet und auch teilweise ziemlich knifflig.
Es bietet auch einen Multiplayer der auch viel Kooperation von dir und deinem Partner fordert.
Man kann auch eigene Rätsel erstellen und die anderer spielen.
Es gibt auch viele, gute Community-Made Mods.
Overall eine 10/10
Best portal game out of the 2
Shot a portal at the moon and it worked so 10/10 game imo

I was a latecomer to this series. I played through the first Portal in 2021, and immediately afterward I played this sequel. Portal 2 was a neat followup. Interestingly, I had seen the ending before elsewhere online, but I had forgotten about it so it still took me by surprise. This game definitely felt more rich in story and felt more anchored in reality. I played this series with a controller, but I'd like to replay a second time with a mouse and keyboard since getting into FPS games. Portal was my gateway to this type of first-person game genre.
